private_information: I can move disks: A, B, C, D, E
I cannot move disks F, G, H, I, J
I must respect Tower of Hanoi rules: move one disk at a time and never place a larger disk on top of a smaller disk
agent_1.goal: Reach the goal configuration: left peg top-to-bottom B, E, F, G, H, I, J; middle peg empty; right peg top-to-bottom A, C, D

private_information: I can move disks: F, G, H, I, J
I cannot move disks A, B, C, D, E
I must respect Tower of Hanoi rules: move one disk at a time and never place a larger disk on top of a smaller disk
agent_2.goal: Reach the goal configuration: left peg top-to-bottom B, E, F, G, H, I, J; middle peg empty; right peg top-to-bottom A, C, D

private_information: I coordinate agent_1 and agent_2 and integrate their move sequences into a single coherent plan
I must produce a PDDL domain and problem targeting the FastDownwards solver that represents the multi-agent Hanoi instance and respects each agent's move permissions
orchestrator.goal: Produce a PDDL domain and problem that encodes the instance and supports the final plan to reach the goal configuration

public_information: There are ten disks labeled A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J with A the smallest and J the largest
Initial configuration: left peg top-to-bottom A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J; middle empty; right empty
Goal configuration: left peg top-to-bottom B, E, F, G, H, I, J; middle empty; right peg top-to-bottom A, C, D
Standard Tower of Hanoi rules apply: move exactly one disk at a time and a disk can only be placed on an empty peg or on top of a larger disk
Agent move restrictions: agent_1 may move only disks A, B, C, D, E; agent_2 may move only disks F, G, H, I, J
All moves must respect the agent restrictions and the Tower of Hanoi rules

move_plan.system_prompt: You are agent_1 participating in a cooperative two-agent Tower of Hanoi problem. You understand the public environment information and your private move permissions. You must produce an ordered list of primitive moves that only include moves you are permitted to execute. Each move must obey Tower of Hanoi rules.
move_plan.prompt: Your name is agent_1. Use the public information and your private information. Produce an ordered list of primitive moves in the exact format 'agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2' where X is one of A, B, C, D, E. Do not output PDDL. Only include moves you are allowed to perform. The global goal is to reach the specified goal configuration. Ensure each move is legal given the current stacking constraints.

move_plan.system_prompt: You are agent_2 participating in a cooperative two-agent Tower of Hanoi problem. You understand the public environment information and your private move permissions. You must produce an ordered list of primitive moves that only include moves you are permitted to execute. Each move must obey Tower of Hanoi rules.
move_plan.prompt: Your name is agent_2. Use the public information and your private information. Produce an ordered list of primitive moves in the exact format 'agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2' where X is one of F, G, H, I, J. Do not output PDDL. Only include moves you are allowed to perform. The global goal is to reach the specified goal configuration. Ensure each move is legal given the current stacking constraints.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with multi-agent PDDL modeling and planning targeting the FastDownwards solver. You must integrate the move sequences supplied by agent_1 and agent_2 and produce a complete PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that represent the two-agent Tower of Hanoi instance. Keep agent actions distinct by naming or parameterizing actions to indicate the performing agent. The resulting PDDL must be compatible with FastDownwards.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. Receive the ordered move lists from agent_1 and agent_2. Use the public environment information and agents' private information. Integrate their sequences, resolve any partial information or naming mismatches, and produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that encode the initial state, the goal state, the pegs, the disks, and two separate action schemas (or annotated actions) for the two agents. The PDDL domain must enforce Tower of Hanoi rules and agent-specific move permissions. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Target the FastDownwards solver.
